text: We use to like this place. It's quick and yummy burritos. Well until last night when my husband got food poisoning last night from them. Yeh never again. Will be calling the health department forsure

Surprisingly, really good! I had the horchata and a chorizo torta, have to request cilantro it's not listed as how they dress it up. It's huge too, and though they do not have pico de gallo the salsa was a good amount of heat n flavor. I'd come back only reason I actually hit the place was because the laundry mat next door, so while the wash did it's thing I eat.... I'm gonna try this place again -- idk cuz I also didn't eat anything all day so there's that factor...
Worst chicken chilaquiles of  my life.  Red sauce just hot AF, but no flavor. I like hot and spicy, but I love flavor. Too bad since its so close  to the house
Great Food Made Fast, also inexpensive compared to most quality eats at this time of the night. STEAK TACOS - 4.5 Stars. Pastor Tacos - 3.5 Stars. Overall a 5 star experience.

Blehhhhhhh. Let me preface this review by saying I relocated to Chicago from Los Angeles, and have never met a taco or burrito I wasn't cool with. Hole in the wall taquerias are my lifeblood.  But.. Should have gone to Taco Bell next door.  Ordered a Burrito Suizo - Red sauce was weirdly sweet, not good. Hardly any cheese on top (which should be a federal offense). Had to drown in salsa and sour cream to make it edible. Pretty sure the burrito was supposed to have other ingredients, but all I saw was meat, tomatoes and like 1 pinto bean.  Side of Chips & Salsa - Also not great, small portion of chips, salsa is a cloudy, weird color and it was pretty bland. Also, I asked for a lengua burrito and the guy said "we don't have lengua", but after I ordered I saw it listed on the menu in English - Maybe he doesn't speak Spanish? Who knows.  No me gusta.

This place is not bad. Don't expect the best burrito you've ever eaten in your life, but it's decent for a nice, quick dinner. We grabbed our order to go and everything was tasty. The portions are a good size and the staff was friendly.

This was previously one of my favorite places to eat, but that definitely changed today because the food and service was terrible.  I usually come here at night and the staff is amazing and the food is excellent. I brought my cousin for lunch and not only was the cashier rude, she debated with me about why they don't make an item I always order specifically from there. To make matters worse, half way through eating my meal, I found hair in my food!!!  I have never had a bad experience with this restaurant but after today it was enough for me to never go back.

This place is lose to home, it not very good.  I have stopped by a couple of times, but I'm usually disappointed.  I have had their tacos and burritos which aren't very good; usually my staple items to order.  They just don't put much meat in their burritos, like almost none!  The tacos have meat, but it's inconsistent; sometimes a lot, sometimes not.   I have found that I do occasionally get their taco salad, which is pretty good.  They seem to be a little better about putting meat in this one.   This is a last choice, only when it's late and my options are limited.  There are much better places for my taco and burrito fix!

This is a perfectly serviceable taqueria, if you just want tacos and/or burritos.  Nothing super special, but adequate.  If you want to order something a little more exotic off the menu, I would urge you not to.  I had a stuffed poblano here that would depress the crap out of you.
You can't advertise a king burrito when it's the same size as a regular burrito. Come on man!  This is America

My boyfriend and I were slightly hungover and actually going to the Taco Bell next door, but it wasn't open. We noticed this place next door and are now in love. We literally talked about how good the burritos were all weekend! Will definitely be back and I just found out they deliver!!! (Bye weight loss goals, hello burrito and sour cream)

This place is really good my sister recommended it to me she's a regular and everything has really good flavor made fresh in front of me my cousins from Costa Rica love it and want me to buy them more today I got tacos I got sopes taco salad from there was pretty amazing so far so good they got my vote I'm a new Customer

I don't understand the bad reviews. It is fast, easy, mexican food and it tastes good. No matter what you order it is quick and and easy and about the same mexican food you can get anywhere else. Sure it is not the greatest but I see nothing wrong with it, the workers are hardworking and friendly and it's a fast food mexican food restaurant... What more can you expect? Especially great when it's late night and they are still open :-)

Late day at work I just moved from the west side and wanted some Mexican food I checked out this place. Can I say probably the worst Mexican food I ever had I ordered some Mexican nachos they gave me yellow cheese instead of Mexican cheese and also tastes like water down cheese. I also ordered a al pastor burrito same thing no flavor I was very disappointed.can I say still very hungry.

No point calling in your order for pick-up. They do not grasp the concept. Just did that earlier tonight, arrived at the restaurant, told them I was there to pick up and watched them put my order on the grill to cook while I stood and waited. Pointless. Also have caught them more than once charging for items that I ordered but they didn't put in the bag.

It's late. Really late. Come on, you know why you are here. Cheap burrito and a can of soda pop might just be a lifesaver, too soon to be "next" day. Chicken or beef? Tortilla wrapper cooked hot and off the griddle. Yum. Get in before 3:50am. Last call!
Food is average. Two star because the door says they open at 9am and the guy inside says 9:30. I've been there 3 times at 9:30, they ignore you at the door and open whenever they feel like it.

Been coming here for a long time on and off when I do my laundry next door .I have noticed  it's under new ownership and at first it was good but know it seems more expensive and less quality .I order a king burrito  but there was nothing king about it ,may b in the amount  of lettuce they put in because I could barely taste the stake  .there's  so many places I can get a burrito this will be my last time here

Although the thing this place seems most famous for on yelp is bad reviews, I needed chips and guacamole and I needed a place close by. I don't usually like to frequent poorly reviewed places but how can you screw up chips and dip?  10$ minimum to pay with a credit card, so I had to double my order. I was in there just a couple minutes because I grabbed the food to go but despite being the only one there, the tables weren't clean. I will post a picture.  In the end I can only judge my own experience and getting the food to go and it being so hard to mess up chips and guacamole... I feel 4 stars is fair
Disappointing.  Tough meat and weak tortillas.  Will not be back, especially with La Pasadita near by.

Unbelievable experience.  This location has delivered to us before 10+ times today after placing an order and waiting the 30 minuet we got a call back saying the delivery guy said he had decided not to come deliver to us.  The person who took our order said I cant make him deliver to you.  We are 6 blocks away and they have delivered plenty of times.  Do not rely of this business I have never heard of a business practice like this.
Steak tacos. Steak tacos. Steak tacos. Just do it. One of the best Mexican restaurants in the area!

So I been living in this area my whole life and I been coming here for about 15 years I have always had a love hate relationship with this place. I don't like there steak because its always rubbery and bland, it has no flavor. Long story short because I can go on and on about this place but today I found a COCKROACH shell inside of my ice. Omg this was so horrible I felt dirty I wanted to scream after all these years I finally have my reasons to stop eating here.

I have been eating here for at least 15 years...yes that is how long this place has been around, and the lady with panther poster has been up the whole time! Now I'm sure it has switched hands multiple times but the food has always been good and cheap. I was lured away when Pasadita opened, but only for a minute or so due to their rude service, gross rice, and lack of red sauce but that is another review. This place is clean, quick, tasty, and reliable. I generally stick with the steak burrito dinner, but have tried many different menu items and have always been happy.  I LOVE their guac and their red sauce.  I also like that the guy who takes my order (I swear he's there 24/7) is super polite and always asks how my day is going. My carry-out order is generally ready in minutes!  Not the fanciest Mexican place in the neighborhood, but definitely my favorite.

I love this place! This is my favorite taco burrito location in the city. The service is always very quick, the food is always very tasty, and the guys that work here are all very nice. I usually get the chicken enchilada meal with rice and beans, but have tried a bit of everything and all is good! I particularly love their chips/salsa here at this location. Good quick, cheap carryout spot.

So tonight I originally was going to get a Nacho Bell Grande from the Taco Bell/KFC combo next door but I thought why not get a better nacho supreme from the Famous Taco Burrito in the next lot. I mean after all it's famous so it must be good, right? Well not so much. While the to go container of a nacho supreme was heaping, all of the contents were mediocre. There wasn't a lot of lettuce, a decent amount of tomato, meet and processed cheese. The steak was extra chewy and not very tasty.  Maybe this would've hit the spot if I was looking for drunk food, but I wasn't drunk :-\ I think next time I'll stick with the nacho bell grande

Not the best, but not the worst.  It falls somewhere in the mediocre medium.... The only reason I go here (and gave it three stars) is for an item that isn't even on the menu: carne asada burrito suiza. A friend once mentioned this concoction, so the next day while doing my laundry I asked these guys to make it for me. That was two years ago. Since then, its the only thing I order. It appears to be quite the popular spot. There are always people either picking up or dining in....
Jimmy John's has nothing on these guys! The delivery is really fast AND free! Cannot think of another place that has vegetarian burritos AND delivers!

Remember -- This is a taqueria, not a restaurant.  No bar, no table service, nothing fancy - just GREAT tacos and burritos. If that's what you;re looking for, you've found your new home. Portions are large, guacamole is some of the best I've had in years - they make it like I like it, with lots of flavor - lime, cilantro, onion and tomato mixed in.  The chips and salsa are delicious, the guys at the counter are friendly and accomodating.  We pass about 15 taquerias on our way to this one - because this one is the best.  The food here takes me back to my favorite taquerias in Mexico.  Go, Eat, Enjoy. Lick your fingers clean.

I got a King sized burrito with Carne Asada and everything: lettuce, tomato, beans, sour cream, cheese.  Had it not been for the salsa verde, I think it wouldn't have tasted like anything. Completely flavorless meat combined with other bland fillings does not a good burrito make.

Of all the choices in the neighborhood this place really didn't do it for me.  Their king size burrito was rather skimpy (long and skinny) for "king" size. What was inside the tortilla did not live up to expectations either.  This is not the kind of burrito you can eat on the go (which is the actually point of the design of a burrito). The ones I have had dripped considerable amount of liquid, giving a rather messy and limp burrito experience.

Why am I updating my review? They chased me out of the door because they forgot to add the guacamole to my Burrito and wanted to give me a container full.  It is a rare experience anymore to get service that demonstrates care for the customer. Top Notch!

if you're drunk and starving at 2 am, this will do the job.  the guac is pretty tasty. i'm usually not a tamale girl, but my girlfriend is, and she was nice enough to share. thank god cuz those chicken tamales were way better than my chicken burrito, which was mostly just bland.

It's about time I do a review for this little gem.  For starters this is 4 houses down from my back alley so I live close.  I call my order in, put on my shoes and walk down.  By the time I get there they are usually putting it in the bag!  With a plethora of bad choices nearby it's nice to have somewhere that is fast, good and fresh.  If you want slow service and overcooked crap go to KFC/Taco Bell next door.  If you want a burger slinged by a guy dripping in sweat you have Burger King across the street.  If you want a decent taco for a great price go to Taco Burrito.  I've had the majority of the menu that isn't made from whatever I consider leftover parts of an animal and haven't been disappointed yet!

Liked the clear menu, free lot parking, clean space with large clean menu, and how dinners come with a medium drink. However, I didn't really like my 2 al pastor taco dinner. The tortillas tasted a little off, and I wasn't fond of the seasoning. Passable but not the best.  2 stars is defined as "Meh. I've experienced better", which is exactly how I feel about this place.

I got take out from here one Thursday evening on my way to a friend's place in Avondale.  I sort of stumbled upon it really as I really just drove by and it looked like it could be good.   I was so hungry I rushed into ordering 2 avocado tortas and a side of rice.  While I waited for my order, I made the mistake of looking at the poster on the wall that had a blown up picture of their enchiladas.  I immediately wanted to change my order, but it was too late.  The tortas were excellent and their green and red sauces were great.  I am usually more partial to the green, but this red had a smokey spice that was a nice change of pace.   I will return at some point and there is nothing that will keep me from housing those enchiladas!

This place has been my hot spot for taco dinners since 2007.  The guys are friendly, always know their customers, and have the best food for the prices.  Their #2 is just as great except I don't live too close to that one.  I'm originally from Cicero and everyone knows the southside is a gem for fine Mexican food but don't doubt this little northside place.  Oh and for the person who ordered the nachos: why would you order nachos there?  You don't go to a place that specializes in Mexican food and order nachos.  You might as well order a chalupa while you're at it.  Lastly, if they served aqua de tamarindo, I'd give them 6 stars.

Ordered nachos platter and two steak tostadas. LIQUID ORANGE CHEESE - like the stuff that goes on nachos in a school cafeteria - 'nuff said. Eww.  There are probably a half dozen other taquerias within a few block radius. Hell, there's a place a block or two west, on the same side of the street. Go there, instead. Only reason they get two stars is because the guys working there were quick and courteous.
This is it. Its nothing fancy, as other posters mentioned, but they make consistently great tacos. I love the Al Pastor!
Really...this place is only good for when your drunk and really hungry. Other than that i would not recommend it. Their burritos i just can't stand.

I love this place. Like heart pounding, palm sweating, butterflies flapping real love.  There is nothing fancy about the decor or the food - unless you count the large print of the woman with the panther on the wall. I choose to turn a blind eye to that, though I suppose it does add a small touch of color at the least.  The food is good and if you're starving, know the portions are plentiful. Everything is made very quickly, to the extent that I am in and out usually in under 10 minutes. I've tried everything from tacos to burritos to tortas to chilaquiles and have liked it all. The menu is pretty typical taqueria fare and the prices are almost ridiculously cheap.  The main thing I love are the employees. Everyone who works here is always so friendly and nice, no matter what day or time I come in. It is a consistently pleasant experience which is unbelievably rare in this era of lacking customer service.  I don't understand why anyone would go next door to Taco Bell over coming here, but since it means I spend less time in line, please continue to do so.

Had the tacos al pastor and carne asada. They were a'ight. The tacos here come with  sour cream and cheese, and it added a smooth creamy accent to the tacos. The al pastor was flavorful, but a little dry. The carne asada had a great meaty texture and taste, not too much seasoning to mask it. It's a small place, but fairly busy. Just  a few tables here, so take out may be the way to go during high traffic hours. If you are lucky, the palleta man might be outside so dessert could be just steps away. Would come back to try a dinner plate.

Wth - this used to be a Taco Burrito King (TBK) until recently - i think it's all upper management stuff and what not.  But I mean this place was THE ORIGINAL TBK.   Good cheap mexican food if you live in the neighborhood and don't want to travel far.  I don't know why it says they dont deliver because they definitely do!! I usually get the steak tostadas and have had the usual dishes on the menu.  I probably pass 2 other taco joints on my way here on my lunch break from work (Paisano's and another new place I've yet to try) but I would rather take out a few more minutes from my lunch for some better quality food. Btw - I'm glad there's new management, the guy who always takes my order is very nice and patient (I tend to forget my wallet in my car).  ANNNND he doesn't call me chinita and burn a hole through my pants with his eyes as I walk out the door (as the previous workers/management did!!)

YEAH!  the real TBK!  the hell with that other TBK by harlem and foster...i've been going to this spot since like '99 or '98... i'm a pretty simple guy and usually stick with either the king steak burrito dinner or the steak taco dinner and large orchata...it's not gourmet, but it's cheap, it's filling, it's 4 blocks away, and it's TBK... minus one star because i wish their food tasted like garcia's, but i still love you dearly, TBK

Been in the neighborhood for years!!. Used to be TBK...but dropped the "King". I have to say that is it pretty decent. I haven't gone here before, but wandered in one day when I was in the mood to try a different place. SOO happy to have a decent taco place in the vicinity. Although not absolutly mouthwatering.....I am extremely impressed with how FAST they put your order together. Everything is just as it should be, but done in literally 3 minutes TOPS. They also deliver..WOO HOO....and have Horchata and Jamica (sp?) juice out with the pop for you to self serve. (same price as pop). They are super cheap, and sourcream /cheese are included for no extra charge.  perfect spot when you need VERY FAST food and don't want BK across the street. i've had their taco, torta, and sopes...all pretty good. Beans and Rice are good...although not to fond of the mixed veggies in the rice. (just not the way I like it)

I went to Taco Burrito because it is conveniently located next to our favorite Laundry Mat called Mr. Bubble! I also dropped in to sample the quesadilla that were so highly recommended by Matt F. Before I mention how the quesadillas were I will mention that I am used to Mexican Take-Out Dives, and side of the street Mexican food vendor stands, and I've had my share of upset stomachs, but I'm usually immune. The Meat Quesadilla combo, with beans and rice and your choice of meat was delicious. I had the pork, and it was Yummy! Although I also got another plain cheese quesadilla to get the whole gooey cheese mess experience which is one of my few food weaknesses. Unfortunately I was hugely let down. I mean I'm OK with wringing out quesadillas, and all the extra oil that oozes out when you heat up good cheese. I've also wrung out my fair share of quesadillas, but this tasted nothing like fine quality cheese grease this had a nasty watery butter taste. Yuck! I will not be getting the plain cheese queso here ever again. I also didn't like the fact that they did not put up the price for the cheese quesadilla, who knows how much I was charged, but I didn't want to stand there looking like the guy who is skeptical, cause ouch I really am that guy! Maybe I'll be back, but I'll be thinking twice.

let's make sure you get this straight people.  this is the original taco burrtio king, but it had to change it's name to taco burrtio and drop the king because there was a chain who stole the name.  i have been to the chain, and trust me........ it's not the same.  nothing beats the original, so don't bother with those impostors.  i love taco burrito so much that everytime i pass it my stomach screams TANGO HOMBRE, YO QUIERO TACOS!!!  so i must grant my stomach it's wish and order up some tasty ass tacos (not to be confused with "ass tacos").  i am telling you that this is not gourmet food, it's a mexican equivalent to a greasy spoon joint.  but none the less these tacos are chock full of goodness and maybe a sprinkle or two of crack.  the hot sauce (both green and red of course) is so good that i had once stolen a bottle......... yes i was totally wasted, but don't you judge me!  in fact the tacos are so good that for 2 whole weeks my boyfriend had driven out to the city all the way from dupage county to stuff his face with the taco-y goodness that is taco burrito.  EAT IT DAMNIT!

Once upon a time I worked the graveyard shift and lived nearby. One disadvantage of both my living situation and my schedule was the laundry situation as my landlady didn't allow laundry to be going after 10pm and I was rarely awake or alert enough to start it early enough so I found myself at the 24-hour laundrioteca next to The Taco Burrito King, or Rey del Tacos y de los Burritos for my espanol speaking fans.  They're cheap, I'll give you that. You get that whole "don't know exactly what I'm eating but hey at least it's not moving oh whoa whoa ok maybe it's moving a little but hey at least it's not singing" kind of experience. The "meat" is typically chunky and fatty, you'll find yourself chewing more gristle than you'd like. The lettuce is a bit soggy, the beans a bit flat but what the hell, man? We're at the Taco Burrito King. Live a little don't worry about the health department so much.  Many a night was spent washing my undesirables and munching on a steak burrito, no tomato or sour cream. Along with this a nice  cool cola and then it was off to desert from the vending machines. Stale 3 Musketeers bar, score!

Looks like a hole in the wall you might not want to eat at, but take the chance. The food is good and filling, and plenty of it. Not the most healthy of choices, but you know that if you're looking for tacos and burritos anyhow.

Ahhhhh, nothing like needing a prime late-nite burrito hook-up, and TBK is definately  the spot.  A bit on the greasy side, but huge portions, cheap prices, and locations that are all around the NorthSide and open late (at least until 3).
